intro: Chabraea tenuisecta, commonly known as the slender-leaf chabraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Chabraea tenuisecta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
